title: Neutropenic Fever Management
summary: Evidence-based guidelines for assessment and management of febrile neutropenia in cancer patients.

content.text: Neutropenic fever is a medical emergency. Initial antibiotics should be administered within 1 hour of presentation.

items: ANC <500 cells/μL or expected to decrease to <500 cells/μL
Obtain complete history and physical examination
Blood cultures (peripheral and central line if present)
Chest X-ray if pulmonary symptoms present

content.text: Initial antibiotic choice should provide broad-spectrum coverage including Pseudomonas aeruginosa. Local antibiogram patterns should guide specific choices.
Consider MRSA coverage with vancomycin if: hemodynamic instability, pneumonia, skin/soft tissue infection, or known MRSA colonization.
